intro: Meyera orientalis, commonly known as the oriental meyera, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Meyera orientalis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and relatively low maintenance requirements.
